decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact help protect your creatures and prevent the opponent from stabilizing. Consign to Memory can be used for removal or card advantage. Teferi, Time Raveler and Stubborn Denial provide additional control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of countermagic, artifact tutors, and payoff cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Thundertrap Trainer to quickly assemble a powerful win condition without needing any lands. The deck aims to disrupt opponent's plans with cards like Disrupting Shoal and Sink into Stupor while efficiently digging through the library with Whir of Invention and Waterlogged Teachings. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish using cards like Lotus Bloom and Tameshi, Reality Architect.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with cheap artifacts and creatures, aiming to deal damage as quickly as possible. The key strategy is to leverage the affinity mechanic to cast spells for reduced cost, while also utilizing artifacts like Engineered Explosives and Weapons Manufacturing for additional control and removal. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal allow for efficient mana generation to keep the aggression going. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Tormod's Crypt and Pithing Needle for disruption and protection against graveyard strategies and key opponent cards.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive creature-based strategy. Utilizing powerful creatures like Ajani and Phlage, as well as efficient removal spells like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge, the deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with various lands to fix colors and enable early aggression. The inclusion of cards like Arena of Glory and Voice of Victory further enhances the deck's aggressive game plan, making it a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

The main concept of the deck is to win without relying on traditional lands for mana acceleration. Instead, the deck focuses on using alternative methods like Hydroelectric Specimen and Lotus Bloom to generate mana. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces such as Goblin Charbelcher and Tameshi, Reality Architect to deal damage or control the game. Disruption and countermagic are also utilized to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately aiming to win the game through a powerful combo finish.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Guide of Souls, Ragavan, and Phlage, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional creature support and buffs. Goblin Bombardment and Redirect Lightning offer additional reach and removal options. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Arena of Glory provide card advantage and additional damage potential. Static Prison and Haliya, Guided by Light offer disruption and protection options. The deck aims to win the game quickly through a combination of quick creatures and direct damage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by ramping up mana quickly using Eldrazi Temple and various other lands, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble. The deck uses powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms to dominate the late game and finish off the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with big threats and powerful spells.

This deck aims to quickly assemble an infinite mana combo using Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber. This allows for explosive plays with Primeval Titan fetching key lands like Vesuva and Tolaria West to find the combo pieces. With access to cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Scapeshift, the deck can quickly find the pieces it needs to win the game. The inclusion of Urza's Saga adds consistency to finding key artifacts like Amulet of Vigor. The deck also includes a toolbox of utility lands to provide versatility in different matchups.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay while disrupting opponent's strategies with cards like Solitude, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Prismatic Ending. It also utilizes powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly close out the game. The deck excels at controlling the board and applying pressure to the opponent, making it a strong contender in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, counter spells, and removal spells. It also includes creatures with strong abilities like Wan Shi Tong and Quantum Riddler to control the board. The mana base is built to support the deck's control elements while also providing access to a variety of colors for flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control over the game by neutralizing threats and outvaluing the opponent over time.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays, disruption, and tempo control. It utilizes a mix of creatures with disruptive abilities, such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, along with removal spells like Prismatic Ending to maintain board control. Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provides early game pressure, while Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury serves as a powerful finisher. The deck is also equipped with versatile cards like Solitude and Quantum Riddler to handle a variety of threats. With a solid mana base and card advantage through Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to quickly flood the board with threats and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It utilizes cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to generate mana and create token creatures, while also using cards like Metallic Rebuke to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes cards like Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives to handle opposing threats and maintain the pressure. Overall, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to rapidly deploy aggressive creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creature beatdown and burn spells. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Guide of Souls provide early-game pressure, while cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge offer reach and removal. With cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Voice of Victory providing additional value, the deck aims to close out games quickly through a combination of creature aggression and direct damage. The mana base is optimized for consistency and efficiency to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck revolves around assembling a diverse toolbox of creatures that can be tutored up with Green Sun's Zenith to generate value and establish a board presence. Yawgmoth, Thran Physician acts as a key combo piece for sacrificing creatures and drawing cards, while Grist, the Hunger Tide provides additional value and versatility. Malevolent Rumble and Agatha's Soul Cauldron offer removal and disruption, allowing the deck to control the board while assembling its combo pieces. The inclusion of utility lands such as Boseiju, Who Endures and Spymaster's Vault enhance the deck's flexibility and resilience.

This deck focuses on using ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly ramp up to powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also includes control elements like Malevolent Rumble and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of ramp, control, and powerful Eldrazi creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while also controlling the board to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Rider combo by using cards like Eldritch Evolution, Neoform, and Summoner's Pact to tutor for key pieces. The goal is to cheat out powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes protection in the form of Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to ensure the combo goes off successfully. Additionally, cards like Disciple of Freyalise and Planar Genesis help ramp up mana to fuel the combo.
